Events that occurred on 14 December.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1937 - J.R.R. Tolkien starts writing a letter to G.E. Selby.
1954 - Voice actor James Horan is born.
1955 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 179.
1956 - J.R.R. Tolkien makes a a speech at the opening of the new Deddington Library.
1966 - J.R.R. Tolkien draws Idril Celebrindal's heraldic device.
1966 - J.R.R. Tolkien inscribes a copy of the Japanese Hobbit to Father Hugh Maycock, and includes a brief note.
1967 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Rosfrith Murray.
1970 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to W.A.R. Hadley.
1993 - Morgoth's Ring is published in the US.
1997 - Inkling Owen Barfield dies.
2004 - The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King (Extended Edition) is released on DVD.
2012 - The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey is released in India and North America.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 3018:
Frodo and Samwise rest in Rivendell and prepare for their quest to destroy the One Ring.
